data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabAdvancedMode
data.value: Advanced Mode

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabHeader
data.value: Home

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabTextBlock1
data.value: This tool helps users process string table files (.csf) that are recognized by Red Alert 2 and Yuri's Revenge. It allows you to:

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabTextBlock2
data.value: Edit the .csf file using your favorite text editor by converting it to an .ini file and then back to a .csf file.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabTextBlock3
data.value: You don't need to keep the .csf file. You can just store the .ini file in your Git repository, as it contains everything needed to generate a .csf file.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabTextBlock4
data.value: More features available in "Advanced Mode"...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabTextBlock5
data.value: Tile the translated file with the upstream file, so you can complete the translation without having to compare two files side by side.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabTextBlock6
data.value: Highlight the translation updates between old and new versions of your old translation, so you can effectively update it.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_HomeTabTextBlock7
data.value: To get started, simply drag & drop a .csf/.ini file here.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_SettingsTabHeader
data.value: Setting

data.name: Xaml_Txt_SettingsGroupboxHeader
data.value: Encoding 1252 Workaround Options

data.name: Xaml_Txt_SettingsTextBlock1
data.value: For code points 128-159 (0x80-0x9F), the original game.fnt file of RA2 mistakenly treats these characters as Windows-1252, instead of Unicode (ISO-8859-1). In some mods and some editors, those characters may be saved as Windows-1252 encoding, which is incorrect. However, users may still need to process these files. You can decide whether to treat 128-159 as Windows-1252 or as Unicode. Checking the two boxes below means the former, which is compatible with some mods and some editors. Un-checking the two boxes below means the latter. This is the correct way. The original game.fnt file has the correct font data at these code points, except for the trademark character ™.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_SettingsCheckbox1
data.value: Enable Windows-1252 workaround when loading the .csf file.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_SettingsCheckbox2
data.value: Enable Windows-1252 workaround when writing the .csf file.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterTabHeader
data.value: Format Converter

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterTextBlock1
data.value: The string table of Red Alert 2 is presented as a .csf file, which is not friendly for editing as most csf editors were created decades ago. This tool allows users to convert the string table from a .csf file to an .ini file and back to a .csf file that is recognized by the game.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterTextBlock2
data.value: Note: the text encoding of the .ini file must be UTF-8 (without BOM).

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterButton1_Basic
data.value: Load a string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterButton1_Advanced
data.value: Load a string table file (.csf/.ini/.yaml/.json) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterButton2
data.value: Save as an .ini file ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterButton3
data.value: Save as a .csf file ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterButton4
data.value: Save as a .yaml file ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterButton5
data.value: Save as a .json file ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_FormatConverterTextBlock3
data.value: The content of the string table file is shown below for preview. To modify it, save it as an .ini file.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelOverrideTabHeader
data.value: Label Override

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelOverrideTextBlock1
data.value: The tool can now support label names containing capital letters. Select an upstream string table file, and your current string table file. The tool will compare each label (ignoring case) and prefer the label from upstream.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelOverrideButton1
data.value: Load an upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelOverrideButton2
data.value: Load the current string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelOverrideButton3
data.value: Save as a .csf file ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelOverrideButton4
data.value: Save as an .ini file ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelCheckTabHeader
data.value: Label Check

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelCheckTextBlock1
data.value: Checks whether there are missing CSF labels in your map files.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelCheckButton1
data.value: Load the string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelCheckButton2
data.value: Select the folder containing map files (.map/.ypr) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelCheckTextboxHeader
data.value: Note: in the generated .ini file, all values of missing labels are replaced with the following text:

data.name: Xaml_Txt_LabelCheckButton3
data.value: Save as an .ini file ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationNewTabHeader
data.value: Translation Helper - New

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationNewTextBlock1
data.value: Select an upstream string table file, and save an .ini file that is friendly for translation. The .ini file can be converted back to .csf file in the "Format Converter" tab.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationNewTextboxHeader
data.value: Note: in the generated .ini file, all values that needs translation are replaced with the following text:

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationNewButton1
data.value: Load an upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationNewButton2
data.value: Save as an .ini file for translation ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationTileTabHeader
data.value: Translation Helper - Tile

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationTileTextBlock1
data.value: Select an upstream string table file and a translated string label file, and save an .ini file that is convenient for comparing and checking. The .ini file can be converted back to .csf file in the "Format Converter" tab.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationTileButton1
data.value: Load an upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationTileButton2
data.value: Load a translated string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationTileButton3
data.value: Save as an .ini file for comparison ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationOverrideTabHeader
data.value: Translation Helper - Override

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationOverrideTextBlock1
data.value: Select an upstream string table file and a translated string label file, and save an .ini file that once a label is shown in the translated file, the value is selected. Otherwise, the label shown in the upstream file is selected. The .ini file can be converted back to .csf file in the "Format Converter" tab.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationOverrideButton1
data.value: Load an upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationOverrideButton2
data.value: Load a translated string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationOverrideButton3
data.value: Save as an .ini file for comparison ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateTabHeader
data.value: Translation Helper - Update

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateTextBlock1
data.value: Select an old-version upstream string table file, a new-version upstream string table file and an old-version translated string label file, and save an .ini file that is convenient for updating the translation. The .ini file can be converted back to .csf file in the "Format Converter" tab.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateButton1
data.value: Load an old-version upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateButton2
data.value: Load a new-version upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateButton3
data.value: Load an old-version translated string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateButton4
data.value: Save as an .ini file for updating the translation ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateCheckTabHeader
data.value: Translation Helper - Update Check

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateCheckTextBlock1
data.value: Select an old-version upstream string table file, a new-version upstream string table file, an old-version translated string label file, and a new-version translated string label file, and save an .ini file that is checked for whether some labels remain the old version. The .ini file can be converted back to .csf file in the "Format Converter" tab.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateCheckButton1
data.value: Load an old-version upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateCheckButton2
data.value: Load a new-version upstream string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateCheckButton3
data.value: Load an old-version translated string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateCheckButton4
data.value: Load a new-version translated string table file (.csf/.ini) ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_TranslationUpdateCheckButton5
data.value: Save as an .ini file for updating the translation ...

data.name: Xaml_Txt_WatchModeTabHeader
data.value: Watch Mode

data.name: Xaml_Txt_WatchModeTextBlock1
data.value: In the text box below, input the pairs of .ini files to monitor and the corresponding .csf files to generate. Separate each pair with a comma. You can enter multiple pairs by putting each pair on a new line. Once the program starts, it will monitor the .ini files. Whenever an ini file changes, the program will automatically generate the corresponding csf file.

data.name: Xaml_Txt_WatchModeTextBlock2
data.value: Example: C:\path\to\stringtables\ra2.ini, D:\path\to\game\ra2.csf

data.name: Xaml_Txt_WatchModeButton1
data.value: Save and Apply
